columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the number of transactions needed to make the lockbox system a viable strategy for the firm based on the concept of the net present value.

We can then substitute these expanded formulas to the original formula for the net present value then solve for the unknown:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{NPV}&=[(\text{Ave. value of payment}\times\text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\times \text{Reduced time}]\\
&-\left(\dfrac{\text{Ave. no. of payments per day} \times \text{Variable lockbox fee}}{\text{Interest rate}/\text{No. of days}}+\dfrac{\text{Fixed annual cost}}{\text{Interest rate}}\right)
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the known values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
0&=(\$2,900 \times \text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\\
&-\left(\dfrac{\text{Ave. no.of payments per day} \times \$0.10}{0.04/365}+\dfrac{\$6,500}{0.04}\right)
\end{aligned}$$

Simplifying the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
0&=(\$2,900 \times \text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\\
&-\dfrac{\text{Ave. no. of payments per day} \times \$0.10}{0.00011}-\$162,500\\[15 pt]
\$162,500&=(\$2,900 \times \text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\\
&-(\$909.09 \times \text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\\[15 pt]
\$162,500&=(\$1,990.91 \times \text{Ave. no. of payments per day})\\
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $\$1,990.91$ to get the value of the average number of payments per day.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Average number of payments per day}&=\dfrac{\$162,500}{\$1,990.91}\\[15 pt]
&=81.62\\
&\approx82
\end{aligned}$$

AN average of $82$ payments per day should be made to make this system viable for the firm.
